org.apache.lucene.util

Class IntroSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.util.Sorter
      • org.apache.lucene.util.IntroSorter

  • public abstract class IntroSorter
extends Sorter
    Sorter implementation based on a variant of the quicksort algorithm called introsort: when the recursion level exceeds the log of the length of the array to sort, it falls back to heapsort. This prevents quicksort from running into its worst-case quadratic runtime. Small ranges are sorted with insertion sort.

    This sort algorithm is fast on most data shapes, especially with low cardinality. If the data to sort is known to be strictly ascending or descending, prefer TimSorter.

    NOTE: This API is for internal purposes only and might change in incompatible ways in the next release.

      Sort the slice which starts at from (inclusive) and ends at to (exclusive).
